TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

[@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) Ok so after copying the shaders from the previous release (0.0255) it appears as if they aren't on.  It doesn't look any different than not having the mod installed anyway.  However, the sunset on the ground is working so I know the mod is active and running. > 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, blackrack said:
> 
> 
> [@Galileo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150430-galileo/) What am I looking at here? Also, do the changes to the orbit shader in 0.0256 bother you?
> 

what Alshain was disliking was the amount of post processing on Kerbin causing it to look like the atmosphere was very very thick. so i cut the post processing down to 0.0 in orbit and changed the sky orbit alpha from 1 to 0.6 and made changes all the way to the ground to blend well together. I hope that answers the question.  The new shaders don't bother me one bit. Here is a comparison pic:

Currently in SVE  
![YmGyNOw.png](http://i.imgur.com/YmGyNOw.png)

The changes i just made  
![3KSSSu0.png](http://i.imgur.com/3KSSSu0.png)

Both look good but one is just a little more real i guess i could say

Thanks for the instructions. I reinstalled scatterer, loaded the game, played a bit with a black sky, then exited.  I didn't notice before, but the ocean seems to be missing, or, at the very least, it's surface seems to be absent. Kind of neat, if I was seeing this on some other planet.  

See?  
![AS-1_zpsbdz3zfpu.jpg](http://i28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/SSgtBaloo/oddities/AS-1_zpsbdz3zfpu.jpg)
